result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. MOTT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
State moves to dismiss and read in.  The defendant plead to charges in 14 CF 545 and 15 CF 447.  Motion granted.
Minutes.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date is set for 08-26-15 at 3:00 p.m. in Branch 1.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Cover Letter.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 08-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
